casebody.data:
BROTHER RECORDS, INC., a California corporation, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. Bradley S. ELLIOTT, Defendant, and Bruce Morgan, individually and d/b/a Deck Records, DefendantAppellee. No. 06-56401. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Submitted Feb. 8, 2008.* Filed May 1, 2008. Edwin F. McPherson, Esq., McPherson and Kalmansohn, David B. Parker, Esq., Michael K. Zweig, Esq., Parker Mills Morin, LLP, Los Angeles, CA, Philip H. Still-man, Flynn & Stillman, Cardiff, CA, for Plaintiff-Appellant. Kenneth A. Feinswog, Esq., Kenneth A. Feinswog Law Offices, Los Angeles, CA, for Defendant. Allen Hyman, Esq., Law Offices of Allen Hyman, North Hollywood, CA, for Defendant-Appellee.

Before: KOZINSKI, Chief Judge, O’SCANNLAIN, and W. FLETCHER, Circuit Judges.

The panel unanimously finds this case suitable for decision without oral argument. See Fed. R.App. P. 34(a)(2).

MEMORANDUM **

In light of this court’s decision in Morgan v. Wilson, Nos. 06-55825, 06-55841, 2008 WL 1924943, we vacate and remand for recalculation of attorneys fees.

This disposition is not appropriate for publication and is not precedent except as provided by 9th Cir. R. 36-3.
